Package agend932

Class MetacriticServlet

java.lang.Object
javax.servlet.GenericServlet
javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
agend932.MetacriticServlet
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
public class MetacriticServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
The MetacriticServlet class handles all the HTTP requests for the Metacritic Scraper application. It processes requests to scrape data from Metacritic, manage the database, and perform queries.
See Also:

    • init

      public void init() throws javax.servlet.ServletException
      Initializes the servlet. It retrieves the DataSource from the JNDI context and stores it for later use. This method is called automatically by the servlet container when the servlet is first loaded into memory.
      Overrides:
      init in class javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException - if an error occurs during the initialization process.

    • doGet

      protected void doGet​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws javax.servlet.ServletException, IOException
      Handles the HTTP GET requests.
      Overrides:
      doGet in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
      Parameters:
      request - The HttpServletRequest object that contains the request the client made of the servlet.
      response - The HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet returns to the client.
      Throws:
      javax.servlet.ServletException - If the request could not be handled.
      IOException - If an input or output error occurs while the servlet is handling the request.

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Called by the server to allow a servlet to handle a POST request by dropping tables. The servlet container calls the destroy method before removing a servlet instance from service.
      Specified by:
      destroy in interface javax.servlet.Servlet
      Overrides:
      destroy in class javax.servlet.GenericServlet

    • processScrapeRequest

      private void processScrapeRequest​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException

    • fetchAllData

      private void fetchAllData​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException
      Fetches all data stored in the database and sends it back to the client as a JSON array.
      Parameters:
      response - The HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet sends to the client.
      Throws:

    • fetchFilteredData

      private void fetchFilteredData​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException
      Fetches filtered data based on search criteria provided by the client and sends it back as a JSON array.
      Parameters:
      request - The HttpServletRequest object that contains the request the client made of the servlet.
      response - The HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet sends to the client.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output error is detected when the servlet handles the request.

    • dropTables

      private void dropTables()
      Drops the database table used to store media information. This method is typically called when cleaning up resources during application undeployment or shutdown. It should be used with caution as it will result in loss of all data in the table.

    • sendResponseMessage

      private void sendResponseMessage​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response, String message)
      Sends a plain text response message to the client.
      Parameters:
      response - The HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet sends to the client.
      message - The string message to be sent to the client.
